snippet: A Supreme Court decision eradicating a key campaign finance limit is expected to widen the world of high-dollar fund-raising now dominated by “super PACs” and big-spending political nonprofit groups.
abstract: News analysis; big donors, leaders of political parties and candidates with access to wealthy supporters will be biggest beneficiaries of Supreme Court decision ending cap on total donations an individual can give to federal candidates; ruling is likely to fundamentally reshape the political terrain in 2014 elections and beyond; is expected to widen the world of high-dollar fund-raising now dominated by 'super PACS' and big-spending political nonprofit groups.

byline.contributor: Eric Lipton and Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A Supreme Court decision eradicating a key campaign finance limit is expected to widen the world of high-dollar fund-raising now dominated by “super PACs” and big-spending political nonprofit groups.

headline.main: Power Surge for Donors as Terrain Is Reshaped on Campaign Money
